SENT.plain: A 46-year-old man presented with acute confusional syndrome, ataxia, dysarthria, and right hemiparesthesia
Brain MRI showed small bilateral infarcts and fluorescein angiography revealed multiple peripheral retinal infarcts bilaterally
No visual loss was present, and no other organs were involved
The diagnosis of Susac syndrome (microangiopathy of the brain, retina and cochlea) was made and immunosuppressive therapy begun
